Destination

Destination is a style sheet that makes websites that are being rapidly-prototyped look beautiful.

The styles are based off of the utility-first Tailwind CSS framework and they include almost all of it's utilities and components. This allows nearly unlimited flexibility while prototyping websites. However, unlike Tailwind, Destination also applies styles from the Tailwind Typography plugin as a base so that basic HTML elements are styled for you without having to manually add utility classes. You can still modify most of the base styles by adding utility classes as "modifiers" but the base styles are meant to free you from that tedium. You can see the Tailwind Typography demo using Destination here.

Destination is meant to be used when the presentation and level of effort matters more than bandwidth so it's probably pretty large compared to other style sheets you're used to (97KB gzipped). You can reduce the size if you need to by purging unused styles but in most cases it's meant to be loaded via CDN:

<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://unpkg.com/ianwalter@destination@0.0.0/destination.css">

Destination will also contain some additional component classes composed from Tailwind utility classes.

Buttons

Default Button

<button class="button">
  Button Label
</button>

Button Variants

<a class="button button-blue">
  Button Label
</a>
